sentences.en: I dislocated my shoulder playing football.
sentences.cn: 踢足球时我的肩膀脱了臼。

sentences.en: It would help to end illiteracy and disease, but it would also dislocate a traditional way of life.
sentences.cn: 这将有助于消除文盲和疾病，但也会扰乱传统的生活方式。

sentences.en: Only an exceptionally heavy snow fall might temporarily dislocate railway services.
sentences.cn: 只有非同寻常的大雪才能临时打乱铁路业务.

sentences.en: Only an exceptionally heavy snowfall might temporarily dislocate railway service.
sentences.cn: 只有罕见的暴雪才会暂时打乱铁路的运行.

sentences.en: Only an exceptionally heavy snowfall might temporarily dislocate railway services.
sentences.cn: 只有非同寻常的大雪才可能暂时打乱铁路运行.

sentences.en: To confuse intelligence and dislocate sentiment by gratuitous fictions is a short - sighted way of pursuing happiness.
sentences.cn: 以无理的幻想混淆智力,弄乱正常的情感是一种短视的追求幸福的方法.

trans.tran_en: to move a bone out of its normal position in a joint, usually in an accident

trans.tran_cn: 使关节脱位，使（交通，事务等）混乱
